trans-unit.source: Creates a path from drive, directory, file name and file extension parts

seg-source.mrk: Creates a path from drive, directory, file name and file extension parts

target.mrk: Creates a path from drive, directory, file name and file extension parts

trans-unit.source: Drive (Can be UNC). If it's a drive letter, a : is automatically appended

seg-source.mrk: If it's a drive letter, a : is automatically appended

target.mrk: If it's a drive letter, a : is automatically appended

trans-unit.source: Directory. A trailing and preceding slash are added if not found.

seg-source.mrk: A trailing and preceding slash are added if not found.

target.mrk: A trailing and preceding slash are added if not found.

trans-unit.source: The file extension. A period is supplied if not found in the extension

seg-source.mrk: A period is supplied if not found in the extension

target.mrk: A period is supplied if not found in the extension

trans-unit.source: Returns the string containing the full path.

seg-source.mrk: Returns the string containing the full path.

target.mrk: Returns the string containing the full path.

trans-unit.source: The path will still be built with what is passed. This doesn't check the validity of the path created, it could contain characters which are invalid on your filesystem.

seg-source.mrk: The path will still be built with what is passed.
This doesn't check the validity of the path created, it could contain characters which are invalid on your filesystem.

target.mrk: The path will still be built with what is passed.
This doesn't check the validity of the path created, it could contain characters which are invalid on your filesystem.

trans-unit.source: You may pass "" (an empty string) for any part of the path you do not need in the final output.

seg-source.mrk: You may pass "" (an empty string) for any part of the path you do not need in the final output.

target.mrk: You may pass "" (an empty string) for any part of the path you do not need in the final output.
